com.yahoo.memory

Class Buffer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.yahoo.memory.Buffer
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    WritableBuffer

    public abstract class Buffer
extends Object
    Provides read-only, positional primitive and primitive array methods to any of the four resources mentioned in the package level documentation.
    Author:
    Roman Leventov, Lee Rhodes
    See Also:
    com.yahoo.memory

      • wrap

        public static Buffer wrap(ByteBuffer byteBuf)
        Accesses the given ByteBuffer for read-only operations.
        Parameters:
        byteBuf - the given ByteBuffer, must not be null.
        Returns:
        the given ByteBuffer for read-only operations.

      • duplicate

        public abstract Buffer duplicate()
        Returns a read only duplicate view of this Buffer with the same but independent values of start, position, end and capacity.
        Returns:
        a read only duplicate view of this Buffer with the same but independent values of start, position, end and capacity.

      • region

        public abstract Buffer region()
        Returns a read only region of this Buffer starting at position ending at end. The region start and position will be zero, the region end and capacity will be this buffer's end minus position.
        Returns:
        a read only region of this Buffer.

      • asMemory

        public abstract Memory asMemory()
        Convert this Buffer to a Memory. The current start, position and end are ignored.
        Returns:
        Memory

      • getBoolean

        public abstract boolean getBoolean()
        Gets the boolean value at the current position. Increments the position by Boolean.BYTES.
        Returns:

      • getBoolean

        public abstract boolean getBoolean(long offsetBytes)
        Gets the boolean value at the given offset. This does not change the position.
        Parameters:
        offsetBytes - offset bytes relative to this Memory start
        Returns:
        the boolean at the given offset

      • getBooleanArray

        public abstract void getBooleanArray(boolean[] dstArray,
                                     int dstOffset,
                                     int length)
        Gets the boolean array at the current position. Increments the position by Boolean.BYTES * (length - dstOffset).
        Parameters:
        dstArray - The preallocated destination array.
        dstOffset - offset in array units
        length - number of array units to transfer

      • compareTo

        public abstract int compareTo(long thisOffsetBytes,
                              long thisLengthBytes,
                              Buffer that,
                              long thatOffsetBytes,
                              long thatLengthBytes)
        Compares the bytes of this Buffer to that Buffer. This uses absolute offsets not the start, position and end. Returns (this < that) ? -1 : (this > that) ? 1 : 0;. If all bytes are equal up to the shorter of the two lengths, the shorter length is considered to be less than the other.
        Parameters:
        thisOffsetBytes - the starting offset for this Buffer
        thisLengthBytes - the length of the region to compare from this Buffer
        that - the other Buffer to compare with
        thatOffsetBytes - the starting offset for that Buffer
        thatLengthBytes - the length of the region to compare from that Buffer
        Returns:
        (this < that) ? -1 : (this > that) ? 1 : 0;

      • getCapacity

        public abstract long getCapacity()
        Gets the capacity of this Buffer in bytes
        Returns:
        the capacity of this Buffer in bytes

      • getCumulativeOffset

        public abstract long getCumulativeOffset()
        Returns the cumulative offset in bytes of this Buffer from the backing resource including the Java object header, if any.
        Returns:
        the cumulative offset in bytes of this Buffer.

      • getResourceOrder

        public abstract ByteOrder getResourceOrder()
        Returns the ByteOrder for the backing resource.
        Returns:
        the ByteOrder for the backing resource.

      • isDirect

        public abstract boolean isDirect()
        Returns true if the backing memory is direct (off-heap) memory.
        Returns:

      • isResourceReadOnly

        public abstract boolean isResourceReadOnly()
        Returns true if the backing resource is read only
        Returns:
        true if the backing resource is read only

      • isSameResource

        public abstract boolean isSameResource(Buffer that)
        Returns true if the backing resource of this is identical with the backing resource of that. If the backing resource is a heap array or ByteBuffer, the offset and capacity must also be identical.
        Parameters:
        that - A different given Buffer object
        Returns:
        true if the backing resource of this is identical with the backing resource of that.

      • isValid

        public abstract boolean isValid()
        Returns true if this Buffer is valid() and has not been closed.
        Returns:
        true if this Buffer is valid() and has not been closed.

      • swapBytes

        public abstract boolean swapBytes()
        Return true if bytes need to be swapped based on resource ByteOrder.
        Returns:
        true if bytes need to be swapped based on resource ByteOrder.

      • toHexString

        public abstract String toHexString(String header,
                                   long offsetBytes,
                                   int lengthBytes)
        Returns a formatted hex string of a range of this Buffer. Used primarily for testing.
        Parameters:
        header - descriptive header
        offsetBytes - offset bytes relative to this Buffer start
        lengthBytes - number of bytes to convert to a hex string
        Returns:
        a formatted hex string in a human readable array

                                                             long position,
                                                             long end)
        Sets start position, current position, and end position
        Parameters:
        start - the start position in the buffer
        position - the current position between the start and end
        end - the end position in the buffer
        Returns:
        BaseBuffer

      • getRemaining

        public long getRemaining()
        The number of elements remaining between the current position and the end position
        Returns:
        (end - position)

      • hasRemaining

        public boolean hasRemaining()
        Returns true if there are elements remaining between the current position and the end position
        Returns:
        (end - position) > 0
